page.title: 09BEACHCOMBING
page.content:
In{Northern Burness}there are many miles of sandy beaches which in our area includes{Scar beach.}They are exposed to the north wind and North Sea which make them ideal for beachcombing. On a fresh day you can walk for miles with only the sound of the sea and birds to be heard.
In suitable winds flotsam comes ashore making walks interesting. Bits of{fish {boxes}and{scrap wood}are washed ashore and make good firewood.
The beachcomber mustn't take any wood from above the high water mark, for this has already been claimed by someone else. Beachcombers look for interesting objects,especially{bottle {messages.}These may have drifted for years in the Atlantic and North Sea tides which meet in Orkney waters.
